summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 3, 2019. The logs detail scheduled observation rounds for inmates in locked-down status, requiring staff to observe inmates at least twice per hour. The sheets are reviewed by watch lieutenants and a captain.

keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated July 3, 2019.
The logs enforce a protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are organized by tier (ZA, ZB, etc.) and shift (Morning, Day, Evening Watch), each reviewed by a lieutenant and a captain.
The document itself does not name any specific inmate, including Jeffrey Epstein, but establishes the monitoring procedures in place at the facility where he was held.
